posts.cooked:
image 1920×2560 342 KB

image 1920×2560 342 KB

image 1920×2560 342 KB

The image above is the photo of Tuner X

After updating the so-called “critical firmware… strongly recommend updating” of falcon500 motor to the version of 24.3.0.2, we were confronted with a fatal haunting bug resulting in an almost catastrophic hardware failure. With this version of firmware, the falcon500 motor will spin in full duty cycle in neutral mode.

It is worth to mention that this bug does not appear in all falcon500 motors with the newest firmware(24.3.0.2). We updated tens of falcon 500 motors in our robot and, so far, only that one impressed us by this “funny” performance.
24.3.0.2 is not the latest firmware. 24.4.1.3 is the latest firmware.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: To be fair, there have been 4 firmware updates within the last week and a half (all seeming to center around this issue).

Yeah but that one was specifically yanked a week ago bc it was too buggy.

List of changes in Phoenix releases
@Vasista have you had a chance to use 24.4.1.3? We’re on all Falcons and haven’t had a chance to update/didn’t want to update if not necessary. Let us know your experience so far!

Did anyone see this on a Kraken?

I’m thinking we got lucky and avoided it, but we definitely need to know about Krakens to ensure we always update the firmware properly.
From what I’ve heard, this was not seen on Krakens. But please don’t take me on my word as I don’t have personal experience with it yet.

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked: In general, it’s a good idea to reset all the config parameters and then reapply any you have manually changed (unless this is done in your code).  It’s not unheard of for newer versions of firmware to not have the same layout of the config parameters and to not handle this properly.

suggested_topics.title: Kraken x60 Undocumented Status Light
suggested_topics.excerpt: It looks like one of the green LEDs is dead or damaged; you can use Self Test in Tuner X to confirm that the actual blink code is simultaneous orange. The motor should still work fine, but if you want…

suggested_topics.fancy_title: SparkMax automatically powers Motor on Startup and Cannot be turned off
suggested_topics.title: SparkMax automatically powers Motor on Startup and Cannot be turned off
suggested_topics.excerpt: Sounds like the motor is too directly connected to the battery. Trace the wiring and make sure the motor is connected only to the output of the SparkMax.
